title: Samsung Opens New Semiconductor Component Headquarters for Americas that Features Cutting-Edge Collaborative Workplace Design
text:
Companies mentioned in this article: Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. 
SAN JOSE, Calif. -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd., the world’s leading producer of semiconductor and display solutions, today officially opened a new campus as the headquarters for its semiconductor operations in the Americas. Local dignitaries and Samsung executives used foot-long golden scissors in the ribbon-cutting ceremony commemorating the grand opening of the company’s Device Solutions America headquarters. Seen here from left to right (Photo 1) are Bob Brennan, Senior Vice President, Memory Solutions Lab; Jaesoo Han, President, Device Solutions America; Mike Rossi, Senior Advisor to California Governor Jerry Brown; Oh-Hyun Kwon, Vice Chairman and CEO of Samsung Electronics; Sam Liccardo, Mayor of San Jose; Young Sohn, president of the Samsung Strategy & Innovation Center; Dongman Han, Consul General of Korea in San Francisco; and Kathy Makepeace, Device Solutions America Employee of the Year (based in Houston, TX). The main facility (Photo 2) features a state-of-the art design for lab and office space that increases interaction among employees and spurs creativity. This Smart News Release features multimedia.
